semantic_title: Fetal Conditions Affecting Maternal Management - O35 and O36 Categories
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > e. Fetal Conditions Affecting the Management of the Mother > 1) Codes from categories O35 and O36

content.full_text: Codes from categories O35, Maternal care for known or suspected fetal abnormality and damage, and O36, Maternal care for other fetal problems, are assigned only when the fetal condition is actually responsible for modifying the management of the mother, i.e., by requiring diagnostic studies, additional observation, special care, or termination of pregnancy. The fact that the fetal condition exists does not justify assigning a code from this series to the mother's record. (Evidence: pg no: 66, L81-L83)
content.summary: Guidelines for when to assign fetal condition codes that affect maternal management (Evidence: pg no: 66, L81-L83)
key_concepts: O35 and O36 category scope (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82)
Management modification requirement (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82-L83)
Specific management changes (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)
Existence vs impact distinction (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign O35/O36 codes only when fetal condition modifies maternal management (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82-L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes are used only when the fetal condition actually changes how the mother is managed, not just because the condition exists (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82-L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Management modification includes diagnostic studies, additional observation, special care, or termination (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: Specific examples of management changes that justify using these codes (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Fetal condition existence alone does not justify code assignment (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: The mere presence of a fetal condition without impact on maternal management does not warrant these codes (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)
common_applications: Fetal conditions not affecting care plan

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify fetal condition or abnormality
Step 2: Determine if condition is affecting maternal management
Step 3: Verify specific management changes (studies, observation, care, termination)
Step 4: Only assign O35/O36 codes if management is modified

code_ranges.description: Maternal care for known or suspected fetal abnormality and damage (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82)
code_ranges.requirement: Use only when fetal condition modifies maternal management
usage_rules: Requires actual management modification (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82-L83)
Not for incidental fetal findings (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)

code_ranges.description: Maternal care for other fetal problems (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82)
code_ranges.requirement: Use only when fetal condition modifies maternal management
usage_rules: Requires actual management modification (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82-L83)
Not for incidental fetal findings (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)

code_categories_mentioned: Maternal care for fetal abnormality codes
Maternal care for fetal problems codes

references_to.title: In utero surgery
references_to.explanation: Related to fetal conditions affecting maternal care

coding_scenarios.scenario: Fetal spina bifida detected, requiring weekly ultrasounds and early delivery planning
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Fetal spina bifida detected at 20 weeks, patient scheduled for weekly ultrasounds and delivery at 37 weeks at tertiary center
step_by_step: Step 2: Confirm management changes (weekly ultrasounds, early delivery planning)
Step 3: Assign O35.03X0 for maternal care for fetal spina bifida

correct_coding.rationale: Fetal condition is modifying maternal management with additional monitoring and delivery planning (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82-L83)

incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Not recognizing that management changes justify code assignment

coding_scenarios.scenario: Minor fetal echogenic focus noted on ultrasound, no change in care plan
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Routine 20-week ultrasound shows echogenic intracardiac focus, patient counseled that this is likely normal variant, routine care continues
step_by_step: Step 2: Determine no management changes made
Step 3: Do not assign O35/O36 codes

correct_coding.rationale: Fetal finding did not modify maternal management, so O35/O36 codes not appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use O35 code when no management modification occurs
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using O35/O36 codes for incidental fetal findings

warnings: Do not use O35/O36 codes just because fetal condition exists (Evidence: pg no: 66, L83)
best_practices: Verify that fetal condition is actually modifying maternal management (Evidence: pg no: 66, L82-L83)
Look for specific management changes like additional studies or monitoring
Document how fetal condition is affecting maternal care plan
common_mistakes: Using codes for incidental fetal findings
Coding fetal conditions that don't affect maternal care
tips: Ask: 'Is this fetal condition changing how we manage the mother?'
Look for additional appointments, tests, or care modifications
implementation_notes: Requires clinical judgment about management impact
May need provider clarification on care plan changes
